topic.title: classcoder.com is about to expire!
topic.body:
So, my domain classcoder.com, which hosts the ClassCoder ZeroProxy, is about to expire, and I need the help of the ZeroNet community to keep it online! I've created a Patreon for the proxy (I'm looking into creating an Ethereum smart contract), so please contribute something to the proxy if you can: https://patreon.com/user?u=3027012

Yes, I know the proxy is currently down. This is completely unrelated and I'm solving it right now (rebooting the VM will hopefully help).

topic.title: Thanks to the donor!
topic.body:
Someone donated about $50 worth of Bitcoin to my ZeroProxy, which will help keep it online for a good while. Big thanks to the anonymous donor!

Transaction: https://btc.blockr.io/tx/info/4f230258c62981ae0e7bb2307ed86b66df1d20b959bab84b1953574ab3dbdccd

topic.title: Would anyone be interested in an IDE?
topic.body:
I'm thinking of making a simple website IDE (not necessarily Zite*, just regular web development, though that could be added later) on ZeroNet using [Ace](https://ace.c9.io/). Would anyone be interested in that?

*I guess that's what we're calling them now?

1_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes.body: Proxy's back up (and with the latest version)!

> [zeronetuser0](#comment_3_1GuSHjNUV97h7BimaK7e32y6q2F91FHJjq): Hello, 
> You should give a look to the plugin "DonationMessage". It is disabled by default.

Oh my gosh. I was JUST looking at the `plugins` folder when I was updating, and I seem to have missed that. Will do!

> [zmccorkle](#comment_3_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes): Oh my gosh. I was JUST looking at the plugins folder when I was updating, and I seem to have missed that. Will do!

UPDATE: it broke everything, I'll just add it to the homepage

> [nofish](#comment_524_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Fixed the plugin in latest revision.

Updated, working!
Even if the domain expires, I've now got an onion version running at [epdb6k6hj4rttycg.onion](http://epdb6k6hj4rttycg.onion). It's the exact same ZeroNet instance.

1_1ArMJqDaBJqeJ4MX3VqSnkfwkHe23PtLrW.body:
> [nippletwister](#comment_46_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): Hello, I've spotted that New ZeroHello site doesn't work via this proxy and ZeroTalk has old interface - without 'Newsfeed' button.

Fixed ZeroTalk, it is intended that ZeroHello doesn't work.

> [ks](#comment_5_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): I tried to put ZeroNet behind a proxy but have problems with the websocket. How do I set up a reverse proxy? TIA!

I'm... not completely sure, actually. I forget how I got it set up, it just kinda "works."

4_1EMpuiFM1NLZmAVyoAWnwi8VwiZVV4dcnN.body:
> [technoturnovers](#comment_2_18KKJyAi6DfN6QG2qs3cSCMQwxpGe3xgvJ): Someone managed to hack the scoring system, it needs to be fixed

Yep.

> [technoturnovers](#comment_3_18KKJyAi6DfN6QG2qs3cSCMQwxpGe3xgvJ): How did you do it?

Open JS console, switch to iframe, `document.getElementById("message").value = score`, `Page.sendMessage()`

2_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes.body: Just purchased zeropro.xyz, will be switching (and setting up a redirect from zeronet.classcoder.com) within the next few hours.
Proxy is now moved to http://zeropro.xyz!

> [zmccorkle](#comment_9_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes): Proxy is now moved to http://zeropro.xyz!

The apex is still propagating, you can go to https://www.zeropro.xyz if you want it now. https://zeronet.classcoder.com also redirects there.

> [basxto](#comment_61_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k): Might be more effective to also ban the used zeronet identity â€¦ if that is somehow possible. But that would need to log which ip belongs to which identity. Not sure if that's a good idea.
> Do you block 0chan and porn0chan on your node?

I do not, and will not, block anything unless there is a complaint from someone upstream (whether it be a host, in which case I might switch hosts, or a copyright holder, in which case I will symlink the folder in `data/` to `/dev/null`.

> [zmccorkle](#comment_11_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes): I do not, and will not, block anything unless there is a complaint from someone upstream (whether it be a host, in which case I might switch hosts, or a copyright holder, in which case I will symlink the folder in data/ to /dev/null.

In other words, rules are in for a large change with the large changes I'm making to the proxy today (new domain, switching to modified ZeroHello)

3_1BidR2Pw65fTPeh1R3LbwCdfEJUPB6FLes.body:
> [pycole](#comment_79_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Definitely would be neat. On the same-ish topic, you might also want to look into electron.

Atom's my favorite editor, and I have done some small things with Electron ;)
